Column Comment.0: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: APPLICATION TYPE: continuation, groupings, license validations, offset noticeappeal, selections, grouping, continuation, significant discovery area, significantdiscovery license, expiry notification, commercial discovery area, productionlicense.The type of application being made, such as application to drill, application toextend a land right, application to conduct geophysical operations etc.
Column Comment.3: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for a contract. Part of the FK from CONTEXTENSION.
Column Comment.4: CURRENT APPLICATION STATUS: The status of the application, such as pending,approved, waiting on documents etc.
Column Comment.5: LAND RIGHT APPLICATION DECISION: the decision on the application, such asapproved, denied etc.
Column Comment.6: DECISION DATE: the date the decision was made.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: CONTRACT EXTENSION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the contract extension.
Column Comment.10: FEES DESCRIPTION: A short narrative comment about the payment of feespursuant to this application.
Column Comment.11: FEES PAID INDICATOR; A Y/N flag indicating that all required fees for thisapplication have been paid.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: PREVIOUS APPLIATION ID: the unique identifier for the previous application.
Column Comment.14: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.15: RECEIVED DATE: the date that this application was received.
Column Comment.16: REFERENCE NUMBER: the reference number on this application.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: RESUBMISSION IND: Indicates that the application was resubmitted, and this rowdescribes the resubmission of a previous row.
Column Comment.19: SECTION OF ACT: Section of an govt. Act or regulation under which the applicationis being made.
Column Comment.20: SECTION OF ACT DATE: Date of the regulation or section of an act under whichapplication is made
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: SUBMISSION COMPLETE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that all componentsrequired for submission have been received. Actual submissions are tracked inAPPLIC ATTACH - this flag is set when all required attachments are logged asreceived.
Column Comment.23: SUBMISSION DESC: Textual description of the lands, substances etc being appliedfor.
Column Comment.24: SUBMITTED BY: Person or company who submitted application. This field isunvalidated and used for as reported values only.
Column Comment.25: SUBMITTED DATE: the date this application was submitted.
Column Comment.26: SUBMITTED TO: who the application was submitted to. This field is unvalidated andused for as reported values only.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
